channel.title: The news is bugging me out man
channel.description:
Sometimes I like watching the news and now when I say sometimes what I really mean is [b]never[/b] because it's too damn [font=GeSHi]scary [/font]these days.
I was watching the MSNBC last night and every time somebody was talking about anything they used the word surge. For example [i]"Barak Obama surged past Hilary Clinton in Iowa". [/i]
Sometimes they would use 'The Word' when it wasn't even remotely appropriate. [i]"Hmm, Tucker, would it be safe to say that Britney Spears has completely surged herself out?"[/i] [i]"Yes, I think, why, Yes Tom, I do think she has quite completely surged, and now let's surge over to Bill with the weather."[/i] [i]"Oh, hi Tucker, the rain is really surging down here in..."[/i]
I watched for two more hours waiting in vain for any mention of the war. Wait...We're in a war? When did this happen? Watching the news one might be under the impression that the most important thing which has occurred in the past few days was a slip in Lindsay Lohans sobriety. And yet they still manage to say the word "Surge" every other word.
Weren't the swooping 3D American flags and "Operation Iraqi Freedom!" in red white and blue with martial drumbeats echoing away in the background warning enough, Paul? You should know by now how those sik basterds work and just give up. Let yourself flow into the propaganda matrix. There is no spoon. Ahhh.

item.title: The news is bugging me out man
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:6, topic:180532”]Kids in wheel chairs don’t talk, they are desperately crying out for people to end their sorry lives but are so retarded it sounds like words.

The news is gay anyways, I don’t want to sound like a rebellious teenager trying to fight society but like the British press are wankers. They turn every story into something bad to scare the public, they are pretty much helping terrorists by reporting failed bombings or uncovered plans which provokes “terror”. It makes people think “ahmagad the terrorists have taken over now I should never go to London and go on the underground cos some towel heads might kill me!!!”[/quote]lol.

thats funny

Read full topic
item.source: The news is bugging me out man

@deoxys505 wrote:

PaulT:

Yeah well, the Canadians can afford to keep it light and cheery. Their unit of money is called the “Looney” and their national pastimes all involve a rifle and retarded children.

wow. the news is kinda weird

and your post above, WTF. thats odd but its true.

item.title: The news is bugging me out man
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Watching MSNBC was your first fault. Freaky shit is bound to happen. Same goes for CNN and Fox.

On Canadian news, you don’t see that shit very often. It’s nice Though, you do hear far too much about little kids in wheelchairs making a difference.

item.title: The news is bugging me out man
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Sometimes I like watching the news and now when I say sometimes what I really mean is never because it’s too damn [font=GeSHi]scary [/font]these days.

I was watching the MSNBC last night and every time somebody was talking about anything they used the word surge. For example
“Barak Obama surged past Hilary Clinton in Iowa”.

Sometimes they would use ‘The Word’ when it wasn’t even remotely appropriate.
“Hmm, Tucker, would it be safe to say that Britney Spears has completely surged herself out?” “Yes, I think, why, Yes Tom, I do think she has quite completely surged, and now let’s surge over to Bill with the weather.” “Oh, hi Tucker, the rain is really surging down here in…”

I watched for two more hours waiting in vain for any mention of the war. Wait…We’re in a war? When did this happen? Watching the news one might be under the impression that the most important thing which has occurred in the past few days was a slip in Lindsay Lohans sobriety.
And yet they still manage to say the word “Surge” every other word.

Weren’t the swooping 3D American flags and “Operation Iraqi Freedom!” in red white and blue with martial drumbeats echoing away in the background warning enough, Paul? You should know by now how those sik basterds work and just give up. Let yourself flow into the propaganda matrix. There is no spoon. Ahhh.
